sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content:
Pic.Width returns the width in pixels of the picture represented by picID.

This function is often used in conjunction with Pic.Height to obtain the dimensions of a picture loaded using Pic.FileNew.
sections.mdown_content:
**Pic.Width **returns the width in pixels of the picture represented by *picID*.
This function is often used in conjunction with **Pic.Height** to obtain the dimensions of a picture loaded using **Pic.FileNew**.

sections.title: Example
code:
var pic : int := Pic.FileNew ("lighthouse.jpg")
        var width : int := Pic.Width (pic)
        var height : int := Pic.Height (pic)
        var x, y : int := 0
        loop
            exit when y > maxy
            loop
                exit when x > maxx
                Pic.Draw (pic, x, y, picCopy)
                x := x + width
            end loop
            x := 0
            y := y + height
        end loop
sections.raw_content: The program draws loads a picture from the file lighthouse.jpg and proceeds to tile the entire run window with copies of the picture..
sections.mdown_content: The program draws loads a picture from the file *lighthouse.jpg* and proceeds to tile the entire run window with copies of the picture..

sections.title: Status
sections.raw_content:
Exported qualified.

This means that you can only call the function by calling Pic.Width, not by calling Width.
sections.mdown_content:
Exported qualified.
This means that you can only call the function by calling **Pic.Width**, not by calling **Width**.

sections.title: See also
sections.raw_content: Pic.Height to obtain a picture's height and Pic.FileNew to load a picture from a graphics file.
sections.mdown_content: **[pic_height.html](Pic.Height)** to obtain a picture's height and **[pic_filenew.html](Pic.FileNew)** to load a picture from a graphics file.
